articles.title: Reply Messages to Heads of State and Personages of Different Countries
articles.content:
Reply Messages to Heads of State and Personages of Different Countries
Pyongyang, March 17 (KCNA) -- The dear respected Kim Jong Un, supreme leader of the Workers' Party of Korea and people of the DPRK, sent messages to heads of state and personages of different countries in reply to their messages on the Day of the Shining Star.
					They were Dmitri Anatoliyevich Medvedev, president of Russian Federation, President of the Council of Ministers Raul Castro Ruz, first secretary of the Central Committee of the Communist Party of Cuba and president of the Council of State of Cuba, Thein Sein, president of Myanmar, Syria's President Bashar Al－Assad, regional secretary of Syria's Baath Arab Socialist Party, Alpha Conde, president of Guinea, Joseph Kabila Kabange, president of Democratic Congo, and Yoweri Kaguta Museveni, president of Uganda.
					
					They also included Vishwanath, director-general of the International Institute of the Juche Idea and secretary general of the "International Kim Il Sung Prize" Council, and Johnny Hon, chairman of the "International Kim Il Sung Foundation".
					
					He in those messages expressed deep thanks to them for sending messages reflecting the ardent admiration and respect for leader Kim Jong Il on his 70th birth anniversary.
					
					He wished them successes in their work, expressing conviction that the relations of friendship and cooperation with those countries would continue to grow stronger.

articles.title: Messages, Letters to Kim Jong Un from Different Countries
articles.content:
Messages, Letters to Kim Jong Un from Different Countries
Pyongyang, March 17 (KCNA) -- Kim Jong Un, supreme leader of the Workers' Party of Korea and the Korean people, received messages and letters from different countries on the occasion of the birth anniversary of leader Kim Jong Il (the Day of the Shining Star).
					The messages and letters came to him from leaders of political parties of Nepal, Malaysia, Syria, Cambodia, Palestine, Indonesia, India, Germany, Romania, Russia, Hungary, Bulgaria, UK, Italy, Benin, Democratic Congo, Egypt, the Dominican Republic, Mexico, Brazil, Canada, Costa Rica, Peru, Ecuador and other countries.
					
					High-ranking officials of political, public, military and economic circles who sent messages and letters include those of Turkey, Malta, Belarus, Slovakia, Poland, Ghana, the U.S., China, Laos, Lebanon, Myanmar, Mongolia, Bangladesh, Singapore, Kuwait, Thailand, Pakistan, Philippines, Kazakhstan, Kyrgyzstan, Jordan, Uzbekistan, Iran, Japan, Norway, Denmark, Switzerland, Sweden, the Czech Republic, France, Finland, Austria, Ukraine, Iceland, Estonia, Guinea, Nigeria, South Africa, Libya, Mali, Senegal, Zimbabwe, Tunisia, Algeria, Uganda, Ethiopia, Venezuela, Chile, Colombia, Uruguay and other countries. Representatives of international organizations, Juche idea study organizations and organizations for supporting Korea's reunification and friendship organizations also sent messages and letters.
					
					The messages and letters said that the life of Kim Jong Il, who was born as the son of Mt. Paektu and grew up to be a great revolutionary, was the brilliant life of an outstanding statesman and peerlessly great man who made immortal contributions to the Korean revolution and the accomplishment of the human cause of independence.
					
					The august name and the sunny image of Kim Jong Il, who demonstrated the dignity of Juche Korea before the world and firmly defended the world peace and stability under the uplifted banner of Songun will shine forever, they noted.
					
					They expressed belief that the Korean people would register greater successes in building a thriving nation under the leadership of the dear respected Kim Jong Un true to the behests of Kim Jong Il.

articles.title: Greetings to Irish President
articles.content:
Greetings to Irish President
Pyongyang, March 17 (KCNA) -- Kim Yong Nam, president of the Presidium of the DPRK Supreme People's Assembly, Saturday sent a message of greeting to Micheal Higgins, president of Ireland, on the occasion of its national day.
					Kim in the message wished the president success in his work for the prosperity of the country.

articles.title: DPRK Premier Learns about Production at Puryong Ferroalloy Plant
articles.content:
DPRK Premier Learns about Production at Puryong Ferroalloy Plant
Pyongyang, March 17 (KCNA) -- DPRK Premier Choe Yong Rim learned about production at the Puryong Ferroalloy Plant on the spot Thursday. 
					Right after the liberation of the country the great persons of Mt. Paektu had a deep insight into the importance of the production of ferroalloy in building a rich and powerful country and made sure that the Puryong Metal Factory, its predecessor, turned into a powerful base of ferroalloy industry. 
					
					The plant has directed great efforts to the production of ferroalloy urgently needed for different fields of the national economy.
					
					The workers of the plant are making innovations in production while stepping up the technological updating of overall production processes with the approach of the centenary of birth of President Kim Il Sung and the historic Conference of the Workers' Party of Korea. 
					
					Choe Yong Rim learnt in detail about ferroalloy produced there. 
					
					After going round the processes for the production of ferroalloy and dust absorption, he convened a consultative meeting of officials concerned. 
					
					The meeting called on the relevant units to take measures for satisfactorily ensuring the supply of equipment and materials needed for production and management to meet the growing demand for ferroalloy. 
					
					That day the premier went round the Komusan Cement Factory and stressed the need to fully display the advantages of local industry.

articles.title: Launch of Kwangmyongsong-3, Highest Tribute to Kim Il Sung, Kim Jong Il
articles.content:
Launch of Kwangmyongsong-3, Highest Tribute to Kim Il Sung, Kim Jong Il
Pyongyang, March 17 (KCNA) -- The news of upcoming launch of the satellite Kwangmyongsong-3 has greatly delighted the employees at the Ministry of Electronic Industry.
					Vice-Minister Kang Chun Nam told KCNA:
					
					"The launch will represent the might of Juche-based industry as well as the nation's science and technology, which the DPRK has developed in difficulties.
					
					A polar-orbiting earth observation satellite, Kwangmyongsong-3, to be launched with President Kim Il Sung's birth anniversary as an occasion, will serve as highest tribute to Kim Il Sung and leader Kim Jong Il."
					
					A department director Ho Chol said:
					
					"I am greatly moved by the local space scientists, who have developed a multi-stage carrier rocket and the application satellite. I will work hard to develop up-to-date electronic products, making contribution to the prosperity of the country."

articles.title: Projected Launch of Satellite Kwangmyongsong-3 Hailed
articles.content:
Projected Launch of Satellite Kwangmyongsong-3 Hailed
Pyongyang, March 17 (KCNA) -- Officials, scientists, teaching staff and students in the fields of science and education in the DPRK are excited to hear the news that the DPRK is to launch Kwangmyongsong-3, an earth observation satellite, to mark the centenary of birth of President Kim Il Sung. 
					Ri Ui Gu, vice-president of the State Academy of Sciences, said the launch of Kwangmyongsong-3, which marks an epoch-making milestone in the history of space science and technology development, is a brilliant fruition of leader Kim Jong Il and the dear respected Kim Jong Un's wise guidance which instilled inexhaustible strength and courage into the scientists and technologists of the DPRK to conquer space for peaceful purposes. 
					
					Its Department Director Pak Sung Chol said:
					
					Satellite launche is something to be desired and envied by many countries in the world as it is monopolized by a few countries. The launch of an earth observation satellite, 100 percent indigenous, indicates that the DPRK has proudly ranked itself among space powers, he added. 
					
					Prof. and Dr. Kim Il Kwang, a candidate academician and vice-president of Kim Il Sung University, said with confidence:
					
					The launch of an earth observation satellite is a proof that the DPRK has made leaping progress in space science and technology and has a solid groundwork for launching satellites for practical use and their regular operation.
					
					Ri Son Guk, head of a department of the University, extended warm congratulations to the scientists and technologists in the field of space science and technology, noting Kwangmyongsong-3 is a precious gift dedicated by them to the centenary of birth of President Kim Il Sung.
					
					Merited Scientist, Dr. and Associate Prof. Ri Won Chol, vice-president of Kim Chaek University of Technology, pledged himself to perform bigger feats in training talents of science and technology and in the drive to break through the cutting edge.
					
					Dr. and Assistant Prof. Jo Se Yong, president of University of Sciences, said: I feel as if I were looking down at the earth aboard our satellite flying in the space. The world will clearly witness once again the spirit of Songun Korea, pushing back the frontiers of latest science and technology.

articles.title: Upcoming Satellite Launch Pleases People in DPRK
articles.content:
Upcoming Satellite Launch Pleases People in DPRK
Pyongyang, March 17 (KCNA) -- The news about the upcoming launch of Kwangmyongsong-3, an earth observation satellite, has greatly pleased the officials of the Ministry of Machine-Building Industry.
					Vice-Minister Choe Chun Gil told KCNA:
					
					"After successfully launching two experimental satellites, Kwangmyongsong-1 in Juche 87 (1998) and Kwangmyongsong-2 three years ago, our scientists and technicians have fully solved scientific and technological issues concerning the application satellite launch. The forthcoming launch of a working satellite, Kwangmyongsong-3, manufactured by our country with indigenous technology will make great sensation in the world."
					
					A department director, Yun Tong Gyu, said:
					
					"A satellite is an important index to national power.
					
					The world is advancing towards a higher level of the knowledge-based economy.
					
					The forthcoming satellite launch will show that Korea does what it is determined to do."
					
					A department director, Jang Song Ho, said:
					
					"Many countries are making effort to explore and utilize the outer space. The DPRK has emerged a satellite manufacturing and launching state.
					
					The launch of Kwangmyongsong-3 will be a great auspicious event for the nation that is translating into reality leader Kim Jong Il's grand plan for building a thriving country. We extend warm congratulations to scientists and technicians who contributed to manufacturing the satellite."

articles.title: Pyongyangites Delighted at News of Kwangmyongsong-3 Launch
articles.content:
Pyongyangites Delighted at News of Kwangmyongsong-3 Launch
Pyongyang, March 17 (KCNA) -- Pyongyang citizens are in great joy over the news that application satellite Kwangmyongsong-3 will be launched soon.
					Han Chang Gil (67), a man living in Haeun-dong No 1, Phyongchon District, told KCNA:
					
					"I believed satellites named after Kwangmyongsong (shining star) would be launched one after another. 
					
					Our country succeeded in launching home-made satellites under the worst situation -- ceaseless blockade and pressure by the imperialists.
					
					It is my great pleasure and pride to think of the satellite which will soon fly high while dealing blow to the arrogant powers keen to dominate the world by conquering the universe."
					
					Han Ryon Hui (43), a woman living in Chongryu-dong No 2, Taedonggang District, said:
					
					"Now I feel great national pride. Kim Il Sung's nation, mentally strong and resourceful, has inexhaustible technological and economic potentials for making anything once it is determined to do.
					
					We will clearly show the world how the DPRK has built up its strength as an independent power."

articles.title: Koreans Sure of Success in Upcoming Satellite Launch
articles.content:
Koreans Sure of Success in Upcoming Satellite Launch
Pyongyang, March 17 (KCNA) -- People in the Democratic People's Republic of Korea, pleased at the news of upcoming launch of Kwangmyongsong-3, an earth observation satellite, have no doubt of success in its launch.
					A teacher of Pyongyang University of Mechanical Engineering, Kim Sun Hui, told KCNA:
					
					"There is no doubt that the forthcoming satellite launch will be successful as it was manufactured entirely with domestic technology. 
					
					The previous successful launch of two experimental satellites had led to solid material and technological foundations for the upcoming launch and its normal operation."
					
					An official of the Ministry of Light Industry, Jong Man Ho, said:
					
					"The announcement on the upcoming satellite launch reminds me of the home-made Kwangmyongsong-1 and 2, that were launched with success in August Juche 87 (1998) and April 2009. 
					
					I feel pride in our country manufacturing and launching satellites with its own effort and technology."
					
					Pak Jin Myong, an official of the Ministry of Land and Environmental Conservation, said:
					
					"The DPRK succeeded in launching satellites in the past in face of the anti-DPRK moves of the imperialists and their followers. I am sure that the upcoming launch, too, will be successful."

articles.title: Mansudae Area Throbbed with Hatred for S. Korean Regime
articles.content:
Mansudae Area Throbbed with Hatred for S. Korean Regime
Pyongyang, March 17 (KCNA) -- Korean people's rages at the insult of the Lee Myung Bak regime to the dignity of the DPRK supreme leadership have been running high at the housing construction site in the Mansudae area in the capital city of Pyongyang.
					Far from making an apology for the insult, the Lee group declared it would not take down the defamatory materials, calling for even "retaliation" and "punishment".
					
					Banners bearing such slogans as "Tear Lee Myung Bak to pieces in the name of the nation", "Kill Lee Myung Bak group of traitors", "Let us beat traitor Lee Myung Bak and military warmongers to death" are seen at every part of the housing construction site.
					
					"Leader, Just Give Us Your Order", "Arms of Mt. Paektu Will Answer", "We Will Defend the Leadership of the Revolution at the Cost of Our Lives" and other songs are aired from loudspeaker cars in the site.
					
					O Hwak Sil (60) said:
					
					"All my family members have come here every evening to help builders in the housing construction. I like to settle accounts with the Kae (dog) Myung Bak group at an earlier date. I really hate the group."
					
					Kim Kwang Ryol, an official from the Ministry of Construction and Building-Materials Industry, said:
					
					"I am so astonished to hear that Lee Myung Bak is still hurting the DPRK. I will work harder with a mind to make revenge upon Lee."

articles.title: Sports Officials Delighted at News of Upcoming Satellite Launch
articles.content:
Sports Officials Delighted at News of Upcoming Satellite Launch
Pyongyang, March 17 (KCNA) -- The news that the DPRK is to launch a home-made Kwangmyongsong-3, an earth observation satellite, gives a great pleasure to local athletes.
					Kim Jong Su, vice minister of Physical Culture and Sports, told KCNA:
					
					"The news makes me feel pride in living as a citizen of Kim Il Sung's nation and Kim Jong Il's Korea. 
					
					I extend my heartfelt congratulations to our space scientists and technicians."
					
					Kim Jong Sik, deputy secretary general of the DPRK Football Association, said:
					
					"The upcoming satellite launch will be the greatest gift to be presented to President Kim Il Sung on his 100th birth anniversary.
					
					It will inspire our athletes to largely contribute to building a thriving nation, under the leadership of the dear respected Kim Jong Un."

articles.title: DPRK Women Footballers Win Title of Int'l Soccer Matches
articles.content:
DPRK Women Footballers Win Title of Int'l Soccer Matches
Pyongyang, March 17 (KCNA) -- The DPRK women football team won the title of the 2012 U-19 International Women Soccer "Spring of Kuban" held in Sochi, Russia from Mar. 6 to 16.
					The event divided into groups A, B and C brought together 12 teams from the DPRK, China, Russia, Ukraine and other countries and regions.
					
					The DPRK team advanced into quarterfinals with nine points in total in league matches. It beat the Krasnodar team 4:0 in quarterfinals and its Romanian rival 1:0 in the semi-finals to play finals.
					
					The DPRK girls trounced their Chinese rivals 3:1 on Mar. 16.

articles.title: Documentary on Mourning over Kim Jong Il's Demise Telecast in DPRK
articles.content:
Documentary on Mourning over Kim Jong Il's Demise Telecast in DPRK
Pyongyang, March 17 (KCNA) -- A documentary film "The great leader Comrade Kim Jong Il will always be alive in the hearts of people" (Part 1), a sequel of "The great leader Comrade Kim Jong Il will be immortal", has been telecast in the DPRK.
					The film features servicepersons and civilians, stricken with grief over the demise of their leader Kim Jong Il, bidding their last farewell to him.
					
					In the beginning the film shows Kim Jong Il standing on Mt. Paektu.
					
					At the sad news of his death on December 17, Juche 100 (2011), which came so abruptly, so untimely and so regretfully, the whole country turns into a sea of tears all at once.
					
					Flags at half-mast are hung countrywide and mourning places built up throughout the country are crowded with sorrow-stricken mourners.
					
					The dear respected Kim Jong Un visits the then Kumsusan Memorial Palace once and again to pay silent tribute to the bier of Kim Jong Il, accompanied by senior party, state and military officials.
					
					Visitors to the memorial palace burst out sobbing to see Kim Jong Il lying in state.
					
					Koreans overseas come to the homeland to mourn before his bier.
					
					Ri Hui Ho, widow of former south Korean President Kim Dae Jung, and Hyon Jong Un, chairwoman of south Korea's Hyundai Group, lay wreaths by his bier and express deep condolences over his death.
					
					Mourners include representatives of diplomatic missions and international organizations in Pyongyang, foreign military attaches and other foreigners staying in Pyongyang.
					
					The film also shows the funeral ceremony, people bidding their last farewell to Kim Jong Il along the 40-kilometer-long route, choked with tears, and a national memorial meeting.

articles.title: Book Dealing with Revolutionary History of Kim Il Sung Off Press
articles.content:
Book Dealing with Revolutionary History of Kim Il Sung Off Press
Pyongyang, March 17 (KCNA) -- Book "Collection of Materials on the Revolutionary History of the Great Leader Comrade Kim Il Sung" (Vol. 15) came off the press in the DPRK.
					The book, which has three parts and appendix, contains materials on the revolutionary activities conducted by President Kim Il Sung from July of 1942 to August of 1945.
					
					The first part of the book deals with remarks made by the President recollecting the time when he rounded off the preparations for actively greeting the great event of Korea's liberation and led the final offensive operation for it to a shining victory.
					
					The second part of the book carries reminiscences written by anti-Japanese revolutionary fighters about the President's greatness on the basis of experience they gained in the course of scouting the enemy's strategic strongholds in Manchuria and Korea and carrying out the final offensive operations for Korea's liberation while conducting military study and exercises in a temporary base in Far East of the former Soviet Union, true to operational plan of the President.
					
					The third part of the book deals with publications at home and abroad introducing the successful final offensive operations for Korea's liberation led by the President and secret documents of the army, police, special service organs of the Japanese imperialists and the puppet Manchukuo. 
					
					The appendix of the book deals with the Japanese imperialists' suppression and plunder of the Korean people and enemies' documents and publications of foreign countries on the anti-Japanese and anti-war struggle waged by people from all walks of life at home and abroad which got intensified under the influence of the anti-Japanese armed struggle.

articles.title: KCNA Reports about Preparations for Satellite Launch
articles.content:
KCNA Reports about Preparations for Satellite Launch
Pyongyang, March 17 (KCNA) -- The Korean Central News Agency issued the following report on Saturday:
					The relevant bodies of the DPRK sent necessary information to the International Civil Aviation Organization, the International Maritime Organization, the International Telecommunication Union and others according to international regulations and procedures as part of the preparations for the launch of earth observation satellite Kwangmyongsong-3. 
					
					The Korean Committee for Space Technology will invite experienced foreign experts on space science and technology and journalists to visit the Sohae Satellite Launching Station, the General Satellite Control and Command Centre and other places and observe its launch.

articles.title: Rodong Sinmun Condemns Lee Myung Bak Group for Escalating DPRK-targeted Nuclear Racket
articles.content:
Rodong Sinmun Condemns Lee Myung Bak Group for Escalating DPRK-targeted Nuclear Racket
Pyongyang, March 17 (KCNA) -- The Lee Myung Bak group's moves to host the "Nuclear Security Summit" in Seoul are a revelation of its sinister intention to justify its policy of escalating the confrontation with DPRK and expand the nuclear racket against the DPRK by relying on outside forces.
					Rodong Sinmun Saturday says in a bylined article in this regard:
					
					The first "nuclear security summit" in Washington in April 2010 was misused by the U.S. and the south Korean authorities in kicking up the DPRK-targeted nuclear racket.
					
					The south Korean puppet forces, who posed constant nuclear threats to the DPRK for decades in alignment with outside forces, have no face to talk about any "nuclear security". It is actually illogical for the Lee group to host an international meeting related to the matter.
					
					The successive ruling forces made desperate efforts to plunge the Korean nation into a nuclear holocaust in collusion with their master, while offering south Korea to the U.S. as the nuclear war testing ground.
					
					The Lee group put on the shelf the criminal acts it committed by bringing the danger of a nuclear war to the Korean Peninsula and described the DPRK's nuclear deterrence for self-defense as a "nuclear threat". It has now gone impudent enough to busy itself hosting the summit.
					
					In order to realize the denuclearization on the Peninsula, the U.S. should drop the policy of hostility toward the DPRK and stop the nuclear threat against it including the nuclear war drills. If the south Korean conservative group escalates the DPRK-targeted nuclear racket while talking about hosting the summit in collusion with the U.S., this will render a solution to the nuclear issue on the peninsula more difficult.

articles.title: Rodong Sinmun on Ever-deepening DPRK-Russia Friendship
articles.content:
Rodong Sinmun on Ever-deepening DPRK-Russia Friendship
Pyongyang, March 17 (KCNA) -- Today marks the 63rd anniversary of the agreement on economic and cultural cooperation between the Democratic People's Republic of Korea and the Russian Federation. 
					Rodong Sinmun Saturday says in a bylined article devoted to this day: 
					
					As proved by the 63-year-long history, the traditional DPRK-Russia friendship has deep roots and it will grow stronger in the years ahead thanks to the joint efforts of the peoples of the two countries. 
					
					Leader Kim Jong Il's visit to Siberia and Far East region of the Russian Federation last year, in particular, marked an important event as it developed the DPRK-Russia relations on a higher stage. 
					
					Visits and multifarious exchange and cooperation have become brisk between the two countries. This year, too, the bilateral cooperation and exchange are growing stronger in different fields. In January the delegation of the Ministry of Fisheries of the DPRK paid a visit to Russia and a DPRK-Russia intergovernmental agreement on cooperation in preventing illegal fishing was signed in Moscow. 
					
					Kimjongilia shows took place with splendor in different parts of Russia on the occasion of the Day of the Shining Star. 
					
					These events provided Russian people with opportunities to look back again with deep emotion on the undying exploits performed by Kim Jong Il for the development of the DPRK-Russia relations and renew the will to boost the traditional DPRK-Russia friendship in the future, too. It is the common aspiration and wishes of the two peoples to steadily develop the long-standing bilateral friendship. 
					
					The secretary of the Russia Association for Friendship and Cultural Cooperation with the DPRK stressed the will to make positive efforts to boost the fraternal friendship and solidarity with the friendly Korean people in the future, too, as required by the present trend of the times when a new history is unfolding for the development of the Russia-DPRK relations.

articles.title: "Kim Il Sung's Korea", Special Write-ups to Centenary of His Birth (3)
articles.content:
"Kim Il Sung's Korea", Special Write-ups to Centenary of His Birth (3)
Foundation of Korean People's Revolutionary Army
					
					Pyongyang, March 17 (KCNA) -- The Korean people waged the national liberation struggle on the basis of guerrilla warfare by the standing revolutionary armed forces.
					
					This way of struggle was created by President Kim Il Sung to liberate the country from the Japanese imperialists' colonial rule.
					
					When occupying Korea early in the 20th century, Japan was emerging a military power.
					
					After "1868 Meiji Restoration" Japan had bolstered its military force for more than 60 years.
					
					On the other hand, Korea in the 1930s was so weak without having its own troops. 
					
					Under such situation, Kim Il Sung declared an all-out war against the Japanese imperialists on the basis of guerrilla warfare.
					
					It was not a simple matter to set forth this line of armed struggle for national liberation when any clear-cut theory on the national liberation struggle in colonial countries could be hardly found.
					
					It had been known at that time that for armed struggle there were two ways -- regular warfare and guerrilla warfare and the former was considered to be the fundamental way and the latter to be temporary and subsidiary one.
					
					But, the Korean people had neither state-backing home front nor regular army. 
					
					Penetrating into this actual condition, Kim Il Sung made a scientific and unique decision that the anti-Japanese armed struggle to be launched by the Korean people should be based on the guerrilla warfare by standing revolutionary armed forces.
					
					On this basis, he, at the winter Mingyuegou meeting in Juche 20 (1931), advanced a unique idea that the Koreans should wage an armed struggle mainly based on guerrilla warfare rather than regular warfare to defeat the Japanese aggression troops. It was a great event to be recorded in the history of national liberation struggles in colonial countries. 
					
					After that he founded the Korean People's Revolutionary Army (then Anti-Japanese People's Guerrilla Army) on April 25, 1932 to lead the anti-Japanese war to victory.

articles.title: U.S.-S. Korea Joint Military Exercises Slammed by Korean in Russia
articles.content:
U.S.-S. Korea Joint Military Exercises Slammed by Korean in Russia
Pyongyang, March 17 (KCNA) -- The chairperson of the Council for Korean National Culture in Partizansk in the Maritime Territory of Russia on Mar. 14 sent messages to the U.S. chief executive and traitor Lee Myung Bak of south Korea in protest against the joint military exercises of the U.S. imperialists and the south Korean puppet warmongers to invade the DPRK.
					The messages accused the U.S. imperialists and the south Korean puppet forces of persistently driving the situation on the Korean Peninsula to the worst phase.
					
					War veterans in Partizansk unequivocally support the Korean people in their struggle for reunification at all times and will struggle against the aggressor forces keen on military clashes against the DPRK, the messages added.

articles.title: Resignation of Managers of Ultra-right Conservative Media Urged in S. Korea
articles.content:
Resignation of Managers of Ultra-right Conservative Media Urged in S. Korea
Pyongyang, March 17 (KCNA) -- The Media Trade Union of south Korea held a press conference in Seoul on Mar. 12 at which it demanded the resignation of the managers of the ultra-right conservative media appointed by traitor Lee Myung Bak.
					Speakers at the conference roundly exposed how Kim Jae Chol held the post of the manager of MBC according to the personnel measure of the Lee Myung Bak "government".
					
					Under the present "government" the MBC has been reduced to MB (Myung Bak) broadcasting service, they deplored, adding there was no such brazen-faced action to put media under control even in the past period of the military dictatorial regime.
					
					They urged the Lee Myung Bak "government" to open to the public how it cracked down upon media, though belatedly, and make those who had been appointed to the posts of managers by arbitrary and high-handed actions step down at once.
					
					They voiced support for the general strike of KBS, MBC and YTN trade unions for media impartiality. 
					
					They declared they would surely judge the present regime in the April general election.

articles.title: All-People Struggle for Abolition of Humiliating FTA Declared: S. Korean Organization
articles.content:
All-People Struggle for Abolition of Humiliating FTA Declared: S. Korean Organization
Pyongyang, March 17 (KCNA) -- The Headquarters of the All-People Movement for Checking the Conclusion of the south Korea-U.S. Free Trade Agreement in south Korea held a press conference in Seoul on March 15 and declared an all-people struggle for the abolition of the humiliating agreement.
					In the press conference speakers said the Lee Myung Bak "government" and the "Saenuri Party" put into effect the ruinous FTA with the U.S. that day despite the opposition of the people.
					
					The effectuation of the FTA will increase the people's sufferings, they deplored.
					
					The day is a disgraceful day, they noted, warning that the Lee Myung Bak "government" will face a historic judgment and be forced to pay dearly for its acts of sycophantic treachery.
					
					They stressed that they will track down Lee Myung Bak and comprador bureaucrats and punish them wherever they might be on the earth.
					
					Noting that justice is sure to win, they said that they will fight it out to get the humiliating and disgraceful agreement abolished.
					
					At the end of the press conference, members of the organization staged a demonstration, calling upon all the people to turn out in the all-people struggle to settle accounts with the group of traitors.

articles.title: S. Korean Authorities Hit for Concealing Truth about Illegal Surveillance of Civilians
articles.content:
S. Korean Authorities Hit for Concealing Truth about Illegal Surveillance of Civilians
Pyongyang, March 17 (KCNA) -- It has been recently disclosed that Chongwadae tried to conceal the truth about the case of the south Korean authorities' illegal surveillance of civilians, a case which sparked off big furor in the south Korean society in 2010.
					The room of supporting ethics of public officials under the office of the puppet prime minister committed illegal acts of following and keeping an eye on non-government employees including the chairman of the Federation of Public Sector Trade Unions under the south Korean Federation of Trade Unions.
					
					It was exposed that even though it is under the office of the "prime minister", the room of supporting ethics of public officials acted at the instructions of Chongwadae and reported its activities to Ri Yong Ho, secretary for employment and labor-management of Chongwadae who has nothing to do with the issue of ethics of public officials.
					
					Ri Yong Ho was a core figure of the Yongpho Society, a private organization of traitor Lee Myung Bak. Much upset by the fact that the Yongpho Society has caught public attention as it was behind the case of the illegal surveillance of civilians, the office of the "prime minister" made much ado, talking about survey. In actuality, it was engrossed in concealing the case.
					
					Jang Jin Su, the then chief official of the office of the puppet prime minister, said that when he tried to open to the public the truth, Choe Jong Sok, former official in charge of administration of Chongwadae, persuaded him not to do so, saying that would risk their lives. Some days ago, Jang opened to the public the taped dialogue with Choe.
					
					According to it, Choe placated Jang not to tell a story to an extreme extent, saying that he will give Jang money enough to live a whole life if he asks for money.
					
					He was finding it hard to prevent re-investigation, Choe said, warning that in case the truth was revealed, Chongwadae and the office of the "prime minister" will not go scot-free and all of them will be charged as Kwon Thae Sin, chief of the office of the prime minister, was disclosed to have presented false evidence.
					
					He blared that even though he bears grudge against Ri Yong Ho, he was risking danger to keep him alive as his early death would be unfavorable. 
					
					Jang exposed that Choe instructed to remove the computer with data, saying prosecution promised Chongwadae not to question the matter.
					
					All facts bring into bolder relief the nature of the Lee Myung Bak group as the bandit of traitors who stoop to any infamy to maintain power.

articles.title: Kim Jong Il's Works Posted on Peruvian Website
articles.content:
Kim Jong Il's Works Posted on Peruvian Website
Pyongyang, March 17 (KCNA) -- Works of leader Kim Jong Il "On Preserving the Juche Character and National Character of the Revolution and Construction", "The Juche Philosophy Is an Original Revolutionary Philosophy" and "Let Us Firmly Arm Ourselves with the Juche-Oriented Theory of Socialist Economic Management" were posted on the website of the Peruvian－Korean Institute of Culture and Friendship on March 11.
					His work "On Preserving the Juche Character and National Character of the Revolution and Construction" which was issued on June 19, Juche 86 (1997) contains the idea that it is the fundamental principle which should be maintained in accomplishing socialist cause to preserve the Juche character and the national character, and tasks and ways for it.
					
					His work "The Juche Philosophy Is an Original Revolutionary Philosophy", issued on July 26, 1996, clearly indicates the idea that the Juche philosophy is an original one that has been developed and systemized with its original principles, and a revolutionary and popular one that truly serves the people in their struggle for independence.
					
					"Let Us Firmly Arm Ourselves with the Juche-Oriented Theory of Socialist Economic Management", which was issued on July 1, 1991, clearly expounds the basic principle, system and ways of socialist economic management.

articles.title: Joint Seminar Held in Mexico
articles.content:
Joint Seminar Held in Mexico
Pyongyang, March 17 (KCNA) -- A joint seminar on immortal revolutionary feats performed by President Kim Il Sung was held in Mexico to mark his birth anniversary.
					Displayed in the venue were works of Kim Il Sung and leader Kim Jong Il and books on Songun Korea.
					
					Ramon Jimenez Lopez, president of the Mexican Committee for the Study of Kimilsungism and member of the Mexican Chamber of Deputies, made a report which was followed by speeches.
					
					The reporter and speakers said that Kim Il Sung wisely led the effort of the Korean people and the world progressives for socialist construction, Korea's reunification and global independence, upholding the banner of the Juche idea.
					
					He is the benevolent father of the people who regarded believing in the people as in Heaven as motto of his life and devoted his all to the people's happiness, while sharing joy and sorrow with them, they said.
					
					They also said that Kim Jong Il, who glorified the Juche idea, Songun idea as the great guiding idea of the era of independence, worked energetically till the last moments of his life to realize the President's desire of building a powerful and prosperous country. He made a great contribution to human cause of independence, they added.
					
					They pledged to more actively study and disseminate the Juche idea, Songun idea with the centenary of birth of Kim Il Sung as an occasion.

articles.title: DPRK's Self-Defensive Countermeasure Favored
articles.content:
DPRK's Self-Defensive Countermeasure Favored
Pyongyang, March 17 (KCNA) -- Political parties, organizations and figures of different countries issued statements between March 8 and 11 to denounce the south Korean authorities for hurting the dignity of the supreme leadership of the DPRK while staging war maneuvers against the DPRK in league with the U.S.
					The National Salvation Front of Russia in a statement fully supported the fixed stand of the DPRK reflected in the statement of a spokesman for the Supreme Command of the Korean People's Army and the statement of a spokesman for the DPRK Foreign Ministry. It demanded the south Korean authorities stop at once all the political and military provocations against the DPRK.
					
					The Secretariat of the Central Committee of the All-Union Communist Party of Bolsheviks in a statement noted that the south Korean authorities are staging the war maneuvers for aggression in league with the U.S. This is aimed at leading the DPRK to a military counteraction like the Yonphyong Island shelling, it said.
					
					The Russian Association for Friendship and Cultural Cooperation with the DPRK in a statement stressed that the present situation proves that the DPRK was very just when it shaped the policy of turning itself into a powerful fortress with war deterrent to defend the sovereignty of the country and the nation.
					
					Kikuo Tashiro, president of the Japanese Society for the Study of Kimilsungism, in a statement denounced the U.S. and south Korea for their war moves, expressing support and solidarity with the Korean people's struggle for the reunification of the country and the peace in Asia.
					
					Seizaburo Ekuchi, representative of the Tokyo-Pyongyang Rainbow Bridge, in a statement urged the south Korean "government" to stop at once the dangerous war provocations and positively opt for improving the north-south relations in the spirit of the June 15 joint declaration and the October 4 declaration signed by the top leaders of the north and the south.

articles.title: Larijani: U.S. Accused of Evil Designs across World
articles.content:
Larijani: U.S. Accused of Evil Designs across World
Tehran, March 16 (KCNA) -- Majlis Speaker Ali Larijani said that the U.S. is accused of committing evil acts across the world.
					Addressing the parliament’s Tuesday morning session, he referred to the crimes committed in Afghanistan and Palestine in the past few days.
					
					He said the savage act of the U.S. soldiers in massacring rural people in Afghanistan is not an event to be easily forgotten.
					
					Referring to burning of the Holy Quran in Afghanistan by the U.S. occupying soldiers, Larijani regretted that the U.S. president just sufficed with calling it a mistake.

articles.title: No Evidence of War Crimes Found So Far: Sri Lankan Army
articles.content:
No Evidence of War Crimes Found So Far: Sri Lankan Army
Pyongyang, March 17 (KCNA) -- An army inquiry into alleged human rights abuses by Sri Lankan troops during the final stages of the war against Tamil Tiger rebels has so far found no evidence to back such claims from the U.S., the Sri Lankan army said in a statement posted on its official website on Tuesday.

articles.title: Azerbaijan Reaffirms Iran's Right to Have Nuclear Energy
articles.content:
Azerbaijan Reaffirms Iran's Right to Have Nuclear Energy
Pyongyang, March 17 (KCNA) -- Azerbaijan's Foreign Minister Elmar Mammadyarov on Wednesday reiterated Iran's right to have a nuclear program.
					Talking to the daily Die Welt, Mammadyarov stressed Iran's right for the peaceful use of atomic energy.
					
					Azerbaijan has repeatedly called for a diplomatic settlement of the stalemate over Iran's nuclear program.

articles.title: Cooperation among Different Countries
articles.content:
Cooperation among Different Countries
Pyongyang, March 17 (KCNA) -- Iran and Zimbabwe concluded an agreement on expanding and strengthening mutual defence cooperation on March 13.
					On the same day the Dominican Republic and Bangladesh signed a MoU to establish diplomatic relations.
					
					Ukraine and Turkmenistan Tuesday agreed to develop the bilateral ties of cooperation in economic and energy fields.

articles.title: Turkish PM Censures Israel for its Air Raid
articles.content:
Turkish PM Censures Israel for its Air Raid
Pyongyang, March 17 (KCNA) -- The Turkish prime minister, addressing the Grand National Assembly on March 13, condemned Israel for its air strike at the Gaza Strip of Palestine. 
					As its blockade proved futile to put the Gaza Strip under its control, Israel made indiscriminate air strikes at it, killing a lot of Palestinians, he said. 
					
					The Gaza Strip has been reduced to the biggest open-air prison in the world, he noted, demanding the Israeli authorities halt at once mass-killings of Palestinians.

articles.title: Anti-Afghan War Atmosphere Mounts in U.S.
articles.content:
Anti-Afghan War Atmosphere Mounts in U.S.
Pyongyang, March 17 (KCNA) -- Anti-Afghan war sentiment is now growing stronger among Americans.
					According to the "Washington Post" on March 12 and a survey of the countrywide public poll released by ABC, 60 percent of the respondents expressed opposition to the protracted Afghan War.

articles.title: Shortage of Water Becomes Serious Due to Swell in Population: UN
articles.content:
Shortage of Water Becomes Serious Due to Swell in Population: UN
Pyongyang, March 17 (KCNA) -- Increase in population is generating serious deficiency of clean water, arousing concerns of the international community.
					UN in a report said that at present nearly one billion people are suffering from shortage of clean water worldwide, warning that the situation will worsen in the future.

articles.title: Australian Consumer Sentiment Falls in March: Survey
articles.content:
Australian Consumer Sentiment Falls in March: Survey
Pyongyang, March 17 (KCNA) -- The Westpac/Melbourne Institute Consumer Sentiment Index fell by 5.0 percent to 96.1 index points in March, from 101.1 in February, a survey by Westpac Banking Corp and the Melbourne Institute of Applied Economic and Social Research showed on Wednesday.

articles.title: Kim Jong Un envia mensajes de respuesta a lideres extranjeros
articles.content:
Kim Jong Un envia mensajes de respuesta a lideres extranjeros
Pyongyang, 17 de marzo (ACNC) -- Kim Jong Un, Maximo Dirigente del Partido del Trabajo de Corea y del pueblo coreano, envio mensajes de respuesta a los jefes de Estado de varios paises quienes le enviaron mensajes con motivo del Dia de la Estrella Luz (16 de febrero, cumpleanos del Dirigente      Kim Jong Il).
					Entre los destinatarios se distinguen Dmitri Anatoliyevich Medvedev, presidente de la Federacion Rusa, Raul Castro Ruz, Primer Secretario del Comite Central del Partido Comunista de Cuba y Presidente de los Consejos de Estado y de Ministros de la Republica de Cuba, Thein Sein, presidente de la Union de Myanmar, Bashar al-Assad, secretario regional del Partido Socialista del Resurgimiento Arabe y presidente de la Republica Arabe de Siria, Alpha Conde, presidente de la Republica de Guinea, Joseph Kabila Kabange, presidente de la Republica Democratica de Congo, y Yoweri Museveni, presidente de la Republica de Uganda. 
					
					Tambien figuran Vishwanath, secretario general del Consejo del Premio Internacional Kim Il Sung y director general del Instituto Internacional de la Idea Juche, y Johnny Hon, presidente de la Fundacion Internacional Kim Il Sung.
					
					En las misivas, el remitente expreso profundo agradecimiento a los destinatarios por haberle enviado los mensajes de gran elogio y respeto en homenaje al 70o aniversario del natalicio del Dirigente Kim Jong Il.
					
					Expreso la conviccion de que seguiran fortaleciendose y desarrollandose las relaciones de amistad y cooperacion entre la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea y los paises correspondientes y les deseo exitos a los destinatarios en sus trabajos.

articles.title: Kim Jong Un recibe cartas de varios paises
articles.content:
Kim Jong Un recibe cartas de varios paises
Pyongyang, 17 de marzo (ACNC) -- El Maximo Dirigente del Partido del Trabajo de Corea y el pueblo coreano, Kim Jong Un, recibio los mensajes o cartas que con motivo del Dia de la Estrella Luz (16 de febrero, cumpleanos del Dirigente Kim Jong Il), le dedicaran los dirigentes de partidos politicos de Nepal, Malasia, Siria, Camboya, Palestina, Indonesia, la India, Alemania, Rumania, Rusia, Hungria, Bulgaria, Gran Bretana, Italia, Benin, el Congo Democratico, Egipto, Dominica, Mexico, Brasil, Canada, Costa Rica, el Peru, el Ecuador y otros paises.
					Tambien le hicieron llegarlos las personalidades de alto rango de circulos politicos, sociales, militares y economicos de Turquia, Malta, Belarus, Eslovaquia, Polonia, Ghana, Estados Unidos, China, Laos, Libano, Myanmar, Mongolia, Bangladesh, Singapur, Kuwait, Tailandia, Pakistan, Filipina, Kazajstan, Kirguizistan, Jordania, Uzbekistan, Iran, Japon, Noruega, Dinamarca, Suiza, Suecia, Checo, Francia, Finlandia, Austria, Ucrania, Islandia, Estonia, Guinea, Nigeria, Sudafrica, Libia, Mali, Senegal, Zimbabwe, Tunez, Argelia, Uganda, Etiopia, Venezuela, Chile, Colombia, Uruguay y otros paises, asi como los representantes de las organizaciones internacionales, las de estudio de la idea Juche y las entidades de apoyo a la reunificacion de Corea y de amistad con Corea.
					
					Los remitentes senalan que la vida del Dirigente Kim Jong Il, nacido como hijo del monte Paektu y crecido como gran revolucionario, fue la vida brillante del destacado politico y gran Hombre sin par quien hizo gran aporte a la revolucion coreana y al cumplimiento de la causa de la independencia de la humanidad.
					
					Subrayan que brillaran eternamente el nombre y la imagen con amplia sonrisa del Dirigente quien glorifico a todo el mundo la dignidad de la Corea del Juche con la bandera del Songun en alto y defendio firmemente la paz y la estabilidad del mundo.
					
					Expresan la conviccion de que en pleno acato al legado del Dirigente el pueblo coreano lograra mayores exitos en la construccion de un Estado prospero bajo la direccion del Maximo Dirigente Kim Jong Un.

articles.title: Choe Yong Rim visita el Complejo de Minas de Musan
articles.content:
Choe Yong Rim visita el Complejo de Minas de Musan
Pyongyang, 17 de marzo (ACNC) -- El premier coreano Choe Yong Rim averiguo el dia 15 en el terreno los detalles de la gestion del Complejo de Minas de Musan.
					La clase obrera de Musan, que trabaja en el sector vital para la industria metalurgica, produce gran auge productivo para acoger el centenario del natalicio del Presidente Kim Il Sung y la Conferencia del Partido del Trabajo de Corea con elevado entusiasmo politico y brillantes exitos de trabajo.
					
					Ellos reforzaron el sistema del taller de enriquecimiento no. 2 para la produccion de minerales concentrados de hierro y realizaron en alto nivel la modernizacion de otros diferentes sistemas de enriquecimiento.
					
					Abrieron las perspectivas de terminar la construccion del taller de trituradora conica de gran tamano no. 2 con motivo del Dia del Sol (15 de abril, cumpleanos del Presidente Kim Il Sung).
					
					Se impulso rapido la reconstruccion tecnica conforme a la demanda de la epoca de economia basada en intelectualidad y se elevo la capacidad de producir minerales concentrados de hierro y evacuar el esteril. 
					
					El premier recorrio varios lugares como la sala de control general del taller de enriquecimiento no. 2 para cerciorarse del estado de produccion y modernizacion tecnica del complejo y convoco la reunion consultiva de los funcionarios de ramas relacionadas.
					
					En la ocasion se resalto la importancia de la mision, que asume el complejo para normalizar la produccion en las fundiciones de hierro y acerias como el Complejo Siderurgico Kim Chaek y acelerar la construccion de potencia economica, y se discutieron los remedios para mejorar la calidad de minerales concentrados.
					
					Ademas, se tomaron las medidas para que las unidades relacionadas suministren con preferencia los equipos, materias primas y articulos de cooperacion, necesarios a la construccion de taller de trituradora conica de gran tamano no. 2 y a la reparacion de perforadora giratoria.
					
					Al finalizar la reunion, el premier exigio a los funcionarios del complejo prestar profunda atencion a las condiciones de vida de mineros.
					
					Anteriormente, el averiguo el laboreo de las unidades de administracion rural de la provincia de Hwanghae del Sur.

articles.title: Choe Yong Rim analiza la Fabrica de Hierro de Aleacion de Puryong
articles.content:
Choe Yong Rim analiza la Fabrica de Hierro de Aleacion  de Puryong
Pyongyang, 17 de marzo (ACNC) -- El premier coreano Choe Yong Rim analizo  en el terreno el dia 15 la Fabrica de Hierro de Aleacion de Puryong.
					Inmediatamente despues de la liberacion de la patria, los grandes Hombres sin iguales del monte Paektu se percataron de la importancia de la produccion de hierro de aleacion y prepararon la Fabrica Metalurgica de Puryong de aquel entonces, predecesora de la presente Fabrica como poderosa base de la industria de hierro de aleacion.
					
					La Fabrica ha venido concentrando  gran fuerza en la produccion de hierro de aleacion necesario a varios sectores de la economia nacional.
					
					En visperas del centenario de nacimiento del Presidente Kim Il Sung  y la historica conferencia del Partido del Trabajo de Corea, los obreros de la Fabrica registran el auge innovador en la produccion acelerando la rehabilitacion tecnica general de los procesos productivos.
					
					El premier se entero en detalles del hierro de aleacion  producido por la fabrica, recorrio el proceso de su produccion  y separacion de polvos y convoco la reunion consultiva de los funcionarios concernientes.
					
					En la ocasion fueron tomadas las medidas para hacer que las unidades relacionadas suministren con suficiencia los equipos y materiales necesarios a la produccion y la gestion de acuerdo con la elevacion de la demanda  sobre el hierro de aleacion.
					
					El mismo dia el premier recorrio la Fabrica de Cemento de Komusan y puso enfasis en promover  altamente la superioridad de la industria local.

articles.title: Informacion de ACNC en cuanto al lanzamiento de Kwangmyongsong-3
articles.content:
Informacion de ACNC en cuanto al lanzamiento de Kwangmyongsong-3
Pyongyang, 17 de marzo (ACNC) -- La Agencia Central de Noticias de Corea hizo publica el dia 17 la siguiente informacion:
					Como parte de los preparativos para el lanzamiento de "Kwangmyongsong-3", satelite artificial de observacion de la Tierra, los organos competentes de la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea avisaron los datos necesarios a la Union Internacional de Telecomunicaciones, la Organizacion Maritima Internacional, la Organizacion de Aviacion Civil Internacional y otras en cumplimiento de las normas y tramites internacionales.
					
					El Comite de Tecnologias Espaciales de Corea cursara la invitacion a los prestigiosos especialistas en la rama y los periodistas de varios paises, para que ellos puedan visitar el Campo de Lanzamiento de Satelites Sohae y el Centro de Control General de Satelites y ver en vivo el lanzamiento de "Kwangmyongsong-3".

articles.title: Rodong Sinmun vuelve a rechazar la "cumbre de seguridad nuclear"
articles.content:
Rodong Sinmun vuelve a rechazar la "cumbre de seguridad nuclear"
Pyongyang, 17 de marzo (ACNC) -- En un articulo individual difundido este sabado, el diario Rodong Sinmun senala que la banda del traidor surcoreano Lee Myung Bak intenta efectuar en Seul la "cumbre de seguridad nuclear", partiendo de su astuto intento de justificar la politica conflictiva anti-Republica Popular Democratica de Corea y ampliar la campana nuclear contra esta en cooperacion con las fuerzas extranjeras.
					La primera edicion de esa cumbre, celebrada en abril de 2010 en Washington, ha sido utilizada tambien para la campana nuclear anti-RPDC de EE.UU. y las autoridades surcoreanas, comienza el articulo y continua:
					
					Los titeres surcoreanos, que vinieron amenazando por decadas a la RPDC con armas nucleares en contubernio con las fuerzas extranjeras, no tienen derecho ni cara para discutir el llamado tema de "seguridad nuclear".
					
					Resulta mas absurdo todavia que ellos fueran anfitriones de la "cumbre de seguridad nuclear".
					
					Historicamente, los sucesivos gobernantes surcoreanos entregaron en bandeja a EE.UU. el territorio surcoreano para que lo usara como campo de ensayo de guerra nuclear.
					
					Dejando a un lado su crimen de haber traido el peligro de guerra nuclear a la Peninsula Coreana, la camarilla de Lee Myung Bak describe cinicamente como "amenaza nuclear" el disuasivo nuclear procurado por la RPDC para la autodefensa.
					
					Para realizar la desnuclearizacion de esa peninsula, hay que cancelar la politica anti-RPDC de EE.UU. y poner fin a los ejercicios de guerra nuclear y otras formas de amenaza nuclear a la RPDC.
					
					Si los conservadores surcoreanos intentan dar mayor dimension a su campana nuclear anti-RPDC auspiciando la "cumbre de seguridad nuclear" en contubernio con EE.UU., esto complicara aun mas la solucion del problema nuclear de la Peninsula Coreana.
